item.title: Packaging python app with poetry2nix using nix flakes
item.description: Background I have some backup logs that have failures I wanted to search and recently came across toolong but it is not currently in nixpkgs. I figured this is a good chance to try out poetry2nix I keep reading about and went through the process of packaging this so I could use it easily with nix.

item.title: Diffing contents of docker containers
item.description: Recently I worked on a project where a large refactor had taken place but I wanted to ensure that there was no changes to the built output of the docker container. So while the diff in Github was quite large with many files moved around the output should remain almost identical aside from a few extra files removed.

item.title: Export PDFs to PNGs
item.description:
Ever want to convert a Google Slides presentation to images without having to save each one manually?

  1. Export from Google Slides to PDF. File > Download > PDF This will let us download all the images at once.
  2. Using the imagemagickBig nix package or installing with instructions from here you can then run the following command in the CLI:

convert -density 300 -quality 100 my-download.{pdf,png}

This will then convert the PDF to a series of images at 300 DPI.

fish shell script for quick access: pdf-to-png ./my-pdf-file.pdf

item.title: Blender Set Frame Plugin
item.description:
Blender plugin to quickly set the render frame range start and end property from the currently selected sequence clip.

  • Quick set frame start and end button Plugin Download.

item.title: Nix flake hostname troubleshooting
item.description:
Have you seen this error?

building the system configuration...
error: flake 'git+file:///Users/matt/nixfiles' does not provide attribute 'packages.aarch64-darwin.darwinConfigurations.Bebop.system', 'legacyPackages.aarch64-darwin.darwinConfigurations.Bebop.system' or 'darwinConfigurations.Bebop.system'

I ran into this and it took me about a month before I realized that I had changed my hostname and that is why my nix flake was no longer building.

item.title: Nix flakes for development
item.description: Background: I had some projects from school that I wanted to revisit and compile again, specifically a game called Worm. This was an assignment that needed to be linked against ncurses which isn’t installed out of the box on most machines. I’ve been dual booting NixOS for some time now on my gaming PC and I thought it was time to start using Nix Flakes with my own projects.

item.title: Cross compiling Go for Winkhub
item.description:
How I cross compiled Go to run on the Winkhub and installed a custom web app to control the lights locally.

TL;DR; Be sure to compile with Go 1.5 with the following settings:
GOOS=linux GOARCH=arm GOARM=5 go build .

item.title: Hacking the Winkhub
item.description:
How I liberated my Winkhub from the Cloud

TL;DR; I rooted my Winkhub over the UART connection and then wrote a small Go web service to allow me to turn my lights on and off from my phone.

item.title: Setup CoreOS with iptables on DigitalOcean
item.description: This post covers how to setup CoreOS with iptables on DigitalOcean. It also covers how to start a Docker container using systemd to keep the container running after crashes and reboots.

item.title: How to enable 5.1 surround sound in VLC on OSX over HDMI
item.description: I recently connected my MacBookPro to my audio receiver over HDMI to play a movie with VLC and try out the Steam in home streaming. I noticed that the audio was not coming out of all my speakers.

item.title: Linux web services Part I
item.description: This is an introduction to a series of talks about setting up Linux servers. I’m going to make the assumptions that you already have some experience at the command line whether it is Mac or Windows so I will not be explaining basic commands in order to keep these talks with in a one-hour time frame. This talk will be done with the assumption you are using a Mac, but you can also follow along using cygwin on Windows.

item.title: Virtual High School
item.description: The virtual high school or Windsor High school map was a project I did in my senior year for school. (2005) My goal was to create the whole school in a 3d environment which could be explored in the Half-Life 2 game engine. I figured the project would take between 80 and 100 hours. It ended up taking over 200 hours. This was a great learning experience for me. While it did end up taking me so long to do it, I enjoyed almost every minute of it.

item.title: Virtual High School Install Guide
item.description: First you need Steam. http://www.steampowered.com Then you need to either buy a copy of Half-Life 2 or The Orange Box to run the mod. This can be picked up retail for between 20 and 50 dollars. It can also be purchased directly from steam. To install copy the “Virtual High School” folder (copy the folder that is in the same folder as the readme.txt file. Don’t copy the dated folder.) to your SourceMods folder in your steam directory.

item.title: fy_glassworld
item.description: This is a map made after one of my favorite Counter-Strike 1.6 maps fy_iceworld. The only difference is I added a little twist to the map for a little more crazy. DANGER ALL GLASS CAN EVENTUALLY BE BROKEN! (Except for the Outer 6 Walls) Download fy_glassworld (for Counter-Strike 1.6)
